meanings.definition: Eager or excessive desire, especially for wealth or possessions.
meanings.sent1: Her cupidity for new toys was evident when she eagerly grabbed every item in the store.
meanings.sent2: His cupidity led him to constantly seek ways to increase his wealth.
meanings.sent3: The cupidity of the squirrel for acorns was so strong that it tried to carry more than it could handle.
meanings.sent4: The cupidity of the dragon for gold was legendary, as it hoarded treasures in its lair.
meanings.sent5: The cupidity of the collector for rare stamps knew no bounds, as he traveled the world in search of new additions.

meanings.sent1: The king's cupidity for power led him to make ruthless decisions to expand his kingdom.
meanings.sent2: Her cupidity for attention made her constantly seek the spotlight.
meanings.sent3: The cupidity of the cat for treats was so strong that it tried to steal from the cookie jar.
meanings.sent4: The cupidity of the storm for destruction seemed unquenchable as it tore through the town.
meanings.sent5: The cupidity of the artist for perfection drove him to spend countless hours perfecting his masterpiece.
